updates_mode_header: Highlight where imagery has been updated or is planned to be updated.
status_filter_tooltip:
Published refers to imagery updates that were made available within the last year.

Pending refers to imagery updates that have not yet been published but will be soon.
category_filter_tooltip:
Metropolitan Updates
Source: Vivid Advanced imagery from Maxar.
High-resolution, up-to-date imagery focused on major metro and high-interest areas worldwide.

Regional Updates
Source: Vivid Standard imagery from Maxar.
Seamlessly blended high-resolution imagery offering consistent coverage across large regions.

Community Updates
Source: Aerial imagery contributed by the GIS User Community.
Recent, high-resolution aerial imagery contributed globally via the Esri's Community Maps Program to enhance the World Imagery basemap.
region_filter_tooltip: Selecting a specific region changes the map extent to only include the sites meeting all filter settings, including status, category, published date, and region.
published_date_filter_tooltip:
The published date refers to the date when imagery was added to World Imagery.

The maximum timeframe for which updates can be accessed is within one year. Updates published more than one year prior to today’s date are not accessible.

Date filtering only applies to updates with a status of Published. Unless expressly turned off, pending updates will continue to be displayed independent of any date filtering.
open_download_panel_button_tooltip: Choose a version from the list to export a tile package.
open_download_panel_button_tooltip_disab: Releases selected for tile export can be managed here.
open_save_webmap_button_tooltip: Save these releses in a new Web Map.
open_save_webmap_button_tooltip_disabled: Choose releses from the list to build a set of Wayback layers for use in a new Web Map.
no_regions_found: No regions found that match the selected filters.
toggle_save_webmap_panel: Toggle Open Save Web Map Panel
regions_cannot_be_fetched: Regions cannot be fetched at this time.
sign_in_prompt_updates_mode: <action>Sign in</action> to your ArcGIS Online account first to see where imagery has been updated or is planned to be updated.
sign_in_with_org_account_prompt_updates_: You are signed in with an ArcGIS Online public account. <action>Sign in</action> with an ArcGIS organizational account to access this feature.
sign_in_prompt_download_panel: <action>Sign in</action> to your ArcGIS Online account first to use Wayback Export features.
sign_in_with_org_account_prompt_download: You are signed in with an ArcGIS Online public account. <action>Sign in</action> with an ArcGIS organizational account to access Wayback Export features.
sign_in_prompt_save_webmap_panel: <action>Sign in</action> to your ArcGIS Online account first to save Wayback layers in a new Web Map.
arcgis_public_account: ArcGIS Public Account with limited functionality
user_of_public_account: {{username}} (An ArcGIS Public Account with limited functionality)
